gaps: Rate Limiting: No scenarios validating throttling behavior or 429 Too Many Requests and related headers.
Caching Behavior: No validation of ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control headers, or conditional GET leading to 304 Not Modified.
Content negotiation/headers: No checks for Content-Type application/json (and charset), Accept handling, or 406 Not Acceptable.
Schema conformance: No explicit validation that Account objects match the documented schema (#/definitions/Account) and that error responses follow a consistent error schema.
Authorization depth: No 403 Forbidden/role-based authorization scenario (if applicable).
Audit enum completeness: No explicit test for audit=NONE as a query value or for case sensitivity/whitespace handling of enum values.
Parameter coverage gap: No scenario with only offset provided (without limit) to verify defaults; ordering consistency across pages is not asserted.
Produces contract: Story says produces application/json but tests do not validate response headers for this.
recommendations: Add rate limiting tests: burst requests to trigger/verify 429 responses and X-RateLimit*/Retry-After headers, plus behavior under thresholds.
Add caching tests: assert ETag/Cache-Control headers on 200; send If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to verify 304 Not Modified.
Validate headers/content negotiation: assert Content-Type: application/json; test Accept negotiation and 406 for unsupported types if applicable.
Add JSON schema validation against the Account definition and a shared error schema across all 4xx/5xx responses.
Extend auth coverage with a 403 Forbidden scenario if role/permission-based restrictions exist.
Cover audit=NONE explicitly and add case-sensitivity/whitespace tests for audit and boolean params.
Add a test with only offset provided to confirm default limit and verify deterministic ordering across pages (stable sort) to ensure consistent pagination.
Add an assertion for produces application/json in success responses (and charset if required by standards).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/refresh - Refresh account payment methods

covered_items: PUT - Valid Request: Happy paths return 204 and actually refresh backend payment methods (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07).
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: Proper 404 when account does not exist, including empty database state (TC09, TC27).
PUT - Concurrency Issues: Multiple concurrent refresh requests complete within thresholds and maintain data integrity (TC23).
Required/Optional Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced; optional Reason/Comment accepted (TC05, TC10).
Input Validation: UUID format invalid (400), overly long accountId (400), unsupported pluginName (400), malformed pluginProperty (400), extra query params handled (TC08, TC11, TC12, TC18, TC19).
Integration/Dependency Failures: External gateway or plugin service down (502/503), timeout (504) (TC13, TC20, TC25).
Security Hardening: SQL injection and XSS attempts are rejected safely (TC16, TC17).
Performance/Resilience: Degraded system or heavy load still meets SLA or returns clear error; gateway slowness handled (TC14, TC29, TC20).
Regression/Compatibility: Special character encoding in pluginProperty and backward compatibility using only required params (TC21, TC22).
State Variations: Accounts with no payment methods and partially populated DB (TC06, TC28).
Large Inputs: Many or large pluginProperty values handled or rejected appropriately (TC07, TC24).
gaps: Response semantics for 204: No assertions that the body is empty and that response headers (e.g., Content-Type given "Produces: application/json") are correct for a 204.
Idempotency: No scenario verifying that repeated refresh calls are idempotent (second call returns 204 and does not create duplicate/unstable state).
Explicit concurrency control: While concurrent requests are timed, there is no validation of locking/ordering semantics or duplicate side effects under simultaneous refresh of the same account.
Server-side 500 handling: No simulation of unexpected internal errors (e.g., database failure) returning 500 with a clear error body.
Parameter combinations: No scenario using pluginName together with one or more pluginProperty values in the same request.
Unexpected request body: No test sending a request body to ensure it is rejected or ignored per contract (e.g., 400/415).
Header validation depth: No checks for length/character constraints or Unicode handling for X-Killbill-Reason/Comment, nor validation that CreatedBy is recorded for auditing.
Content negotiation: No tests verifying Accept handling or absence/presence of Content-Type header consistency for this endpoint.
recommendations: Add a scenario to assert 204 responses have no body and verify response headers (e.g., Content-Type behavior given "Produces: application/json").
Add an idempotency test: invoke refresh twice for the same account and verify consistent state, no duplicates, and 204 responses.

Strengthen concurrency testing: fire simultaneous refreshes for the same account and verify no race-induced inconsistencies, duplicates, or partial writes; confirm any locking or deduplication behavior.
Introduce a server error simulation (e.g., forced DB failure) to validate 500 handling with a clear, actionable error payload.
Create a scenario combining pluginName with multiple pluginProperty values to validate parameter interplay.
Add a negative test that includes an unexpected request body, asserting the API returns 400/415 or explicitly ignores the body per spec.
Extend header validation: test max length, invalid characters, and Unicode in X-Killbill-Reason/Comment, and verify X-Killbill-CreatedBy is captured in audit logs.
Add a content-negotiation scenario to verify Accept is honored (or not required) and that headers remain consistent across success and error responses.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Add custom fields to payment

covered_items: POST - Valid Payload: Happy-path creation returns 201 with a JSON array of created CustomField objects (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy handled; optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment supported (TC01, TC02).
Path parameter validation: invalid UUID -> 400 (TC10); non-existent paymentId -> 404 (TC11); valid paymentId succeeds.
Request body validation: malformed JSON -> 400 (TC08); missing required CustomField properties -> 400 (TC16); empty array scenario considered (TC07); unexpected fields behavior explored (TC06).
Authorization: missing/invalid auth token -> 401 (TC12).
Resilience: dependent service unavailable -> 503 (TC13); network latency/timeout behavior covered (TC18).
Performance: normal and peak load SLAs covered (TC22, TC23).
Security: SQL injection/XSS inputs are rejected or sanitized; no malicious persistence (TC14).
Concurrency: concurrent POSTs to same payment are handled without data loss (TC19).
Integration/persistence: created fields retrievable via GET; cross-system consistency checked (TC24, TC25).
gaps: Server Error Handling: No explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenario; only 503 is covered.
Duplicate Submission: No scenario reposting the same payload to the same payment to verify idempotency or duplicate handling (e.g., 201 first, then 200/409/422).
Response headers and content negotiation: No assertion that responses include Content-Type: application/json for success and errors; no Accept header handling or 406 Not Acceptable case.
Unsupported Media Type: No test for missing/incorrect Content-Type (e.g., text/plain) leading to 415.
Request body type validation: No negative test where body is not an array or contains non-CustomField elements (e.g., single object, string, null) -> 400.
Spec alignment ambiguity: TC06/TC07/TC20 use "201 or 400 depending" instead of asserting the contract; story marks body as required and implies validation errors should be 400.
Error payload schema: No checks that error responses follow a standard structure (e.g., code, message, type, requestId).
Produces requirement: Story states produces application/json but there is no verification of response media type or charset.
recommendations: Add a scenario simulating an unexpected server exception to validate 500 mapping and payload (e.g., database exception -> 500).
Add duplicate submission/idempotency scenarios: post the same array twice and define expected behavior (201 then 200/409/422) and ensure no duplicates are created.
Assert response headers: verify Content-Type: application/json on 201 and error responses; optionally assert charset.
Add 415 Unsupported Media Type tests for missing or incorrect Content-Type and a positive case for correct Content-Type.
Add request body type validation tests: non-array body, null body, array with non-object entries -> 400 with clear validation messages.
Tighten TC06, TC07, TC20 to single expected outcomes per API contract (avoid "201 or 400"); align with schema and acceptance criteria.
Validate standardized error payload schema (fields like code, message, type) and include examples in assertions.
Optionally add Accept header tests (e.g., Accept: text/xml) to confirm 406 Not Acceptable if content negotiation is enforced.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/catalog/simplePlan - Add a simple plan entry in the current version of the catalog

covered_items: POST/Valid Payload: Happy paths with 201 Created and confirmation string/URI (TC01, TC02), and retrievability (TC01).
POST/Invalid Payload: Missing required header (TC03), missing fields (TC04), invalid currency (TC05), empty body (TC08), malformed JSON (TC09), security validation for XSS/SQLi (TC18).
POST/Duplicate Submission: Existing planId conflict handled with 400 (TC06).
POST/Large Payloads: Very large payload behavior considered (TC15).
Validation/Boundaries: Max field lengths (TC12) and minimum values (TC13).
Authorization: 401 for missing auth (TC10).
Resilience/Availability: 503 when catalog unavailable or degraded dependencies (TC11, TC24); integration propagation checked (TC23).
Method Handling: 405 for unsupported method (TC14).
Operational/Non-functional: Concurrency of creates (TC22), retry after transient network failure (TC16), basic performance threshold (TC17).
Schema leniency: Extra unsupported fields tolerated without failure (TC07).
gaps: POST/Server Error Handling: No simulation of unexpected 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., DB write failure) and recovery behavior.
Content Negotiation: No tests for missing/incorrect Content-Type resulting in 415 Unsupported Media Type; no Accept header/406 handling; response Content-Type verification absent.

Field-Level Validation Depth: No tests for invalid enum values (billingPeriod, productCategory), negative/zero amount (if disallowed), numeric precision/scale, or wrong JSON types (e.g., amount as string).
Authorization/Permissions: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated but unauthorized user/role.
Idempotency/Duplicate Retries: No test for duplicate POST of the same payload (replay) to ensure no second resource is created and the response code is consistent (e.g., 400/409).
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No test for 429 Too Many Requests under high-frequency calls.
Response Headers: No verification of Location header (if provided) or other expected headers on 201; no error response schema checks.
Audit Header Edge Cases: No validation for empty/whitespace or overlong X-Killbill-CreatedBy, and bounds for optional Reason/Comment.
recommendations: Add server-fault scenarios: force backend/database failure to assert 500 handling, stable error schema, and no partial writes.
Add content-negotiation tests: missing Content-Type, wrong Content-Type (e.g., text/plain) -> 415; Accept header not supported -> 406; assert response Content-Type on success/error.
Expand validation matrix: invalid billingPeriod/productCategory enums; negative/zero amount and out-of-range amounts; excessive decimal precision; wrong JSON types for fields; invalid planId format.
Add authorization test for 403 Forbidden (authenticated user without required permissions).
Test duplicate replay: send the same POST twice (with same payload) and verify only one plan exists; assert second call returns expected error (400/409) and system remains consistent.
Introduce rate limiting test to validate 429 behavior (if applicable) and proper Retry-After headers.
Verify response headers on 201: Location (if specified), Content-Type, and any audit/correlation IDs; verify consistent error response schema for 4xx/5xx.
Add audit header edge cases: empty/whitespace-only or overly long X-Killbill-CreatedBy; bounds for Reason/Comment; character set/Unicode handling in headers and payload.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId} - Retrieve an account by id

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful retrieval for a valid accountId with default behavior and multiple valid query parameter combinations returning 200 with correct fields.
Empty Response/Not Found: 404 covered for non-existent accountId and when no accounts exist.

Query Parameters: Broad coverage of accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, and audit (FULL/MINIMAL/NONE), including combinations, conflicting values, missing/blank values, and unsupported values.
Authorization: 401 covered for missing and invalid tokens.
Input Validation/Security: 400 for malformed UUID, SQLi and XSS payloads in path param with no leakage of sensitive info.
Resilience/Perf: Scenarios for timeout under load (200 or 504), service unavailable (503), transient network retry, large payload handling, and concurrent requests consistency.
Robustness: Extra unexpected query parameters are ignored with successful 200 response.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, Cache-Control, or 304 Not Modified responses.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios for burst traffic leading to 429 Too Many Requests and related headers (Retry-After, rate-limit headers).
Content Negotiation and Headers: No assertions for Content-Type: application/json (produces), nor behavior with Accept headers (e.g., 406 when unacceptable).
Schema Verification: No explicit JSON schema validation of the Account object against the contract (#/definitions/Account).
Server Error Variants: While 503 is covered, there is no coverage for generic 500 Internal Server Error behavior and error payload format.
Authorization 403 (role/permission): If RBAC applies, there are no tests for authenticated but unauthorized access returning 403.
recommendations: Add caching tests: initial GET returns ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control; repeat with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to assert 304 Not Modified and correct validators.
Add rate limiting tests to simulate high request rates and assert 429, Retry-After, and rate-limit headers; verify recovery after window resets.
Add header-focused tests: assert Content-Type: application/json on success; exercise Accept negotiation (e.g., Accept: application/xml -> 406 or negotiated behavior).
Introduce schema validation steps to assert the response matches the Account JSON schema (field presence/types) across key scenarios.
Include a 500 Internal Server Error simulation (e.g., DB failure) to verify correct status code and standardized error body.
If applicable, add a 403 Forbidden scenario for users lacking permissions to access specific accounts.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoices - Retrieve account invoices

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful 200 responses with correct filtering across many combinations (startDate/endDate, withMigrationInvoices, unpaidInvoicesOnly, includeVoidedInvoices, audit=FULL/MINIMAL).
Empty Response: 200 with empty array when no invoices exist or filters yield no results.
Query Parameters: Broad coverage of valid combos and edge cases (partial dates, startDate > endDate -> 400, unsupported params ignored, security inputs like SQLi/XSS rejected).
Authorization: 401 for missing/invalid tokens.
Error Handling: 400 for invalid accountId/malformed UUID and oversized path; 404 for non-existent account.
Resilience/Availability: 503 service unavailable; potential 504 on slow downstream; concurrent request consistency.
Performance: Large data-volume scenario with response-time assertion.
Regression/Compatibility: Backward compatibility with no query params; regression on unpaidInvoicesOnly behavior.
gaps: Pagination: No concrete assertions for pagination mechanics (e.g., page size params, next/prev links, total counts); TC16 notes "may be paginated" but does not validate it.
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Last-Modified or Cache-Control headers, nor conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) behavior.
Rate Limiting: No tests for throttling/429 responses under burst traffic distinct from simple concurrency.
Response Headers/Content Negotiation: No verification of Content-Type=application/json or Accept handling as stated in story (Produces: application/json).
Schema Validation: No validation against the Invoice schema definition (#/definitions/Invoice) or structure of audit fields for each level.
Audit Defaults/Invalid Enum: No test for default audit=NONE when omitted, and no simple invalid enum value (e.g., audit=FOO) returning 400/422.
Date Format Validation: Missing tests for malformed/unsupported date formats (e.g., 2023-13-40, non-ISO), and timezone boundary handling if applicable.
Authorization 403: No scenario for forbidden/insufficient permissions or scopes (if the API distinguishes 401 vs 403).
Server Error 500: No test simulating internal errors (e.g., DB failure) returning 500 for GET.
Deterministic Ordering: No assertion on sort order of returned invoices (if the API specifies ordering).
recommendations: Add explicit pagination scenarios: request first page with limit, verify item count, presence/values of pagination metadata (e.g., next/prev links or offset/limit), and navigate to subsequent pages.
Add caching tests: assert ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control headers on 200; send If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to expect 304 Not Modified when appropriate.
Introduce rate-limiting tests: burst N requests within a short window to validate 429 Too Many Requests (or confirm not applicable).
Verify response headers: assert Content-Type=application/json; optionally test Accept header variations and ensure JSON is returned.
Validate response schema: check each item conforms to #/definitions/Invoice; validate required fields and types and audit sections for FULL and MINIMAL.
Cover audit defaults and invalids: a) omit audit to verify default NONE behavior; b) use an invalid value (audit=FOO) to assert 400/422.
Add invalid date format tests: non-ISO strings, out-of-range dates; include timezone-related cases (UTC vs account timezone) if defined.
Consider a 403 forbidden test if the platform enforces permission scopes distinct from authentication failures.
Simulate internal error path: mock DB/service failure to ensure 500 handling and error body contract.
If the API defines ordering, add an assertion (e.g., newest-first by invoiceDate) to ensure deterministic results.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/payments/{paymentId}/transactions/{paymentTransactionId} - Update existing paymentTransaction and associated payment state

covered_items: PUT - Valid Request: Happy-path updates with HTTP 204 and DB state verification (TC01, TC02, TC23, TC14, TC15).
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: 404 for missing payment/transaction and empty DB (TC06, TC07, TC12).
PUT - Concurrency Issues: Concurrent updates verify consistency and no corruption (TC17).
PUT - Partial Update: Scenario with only required fields suggests partial updates are supported (TC23).
Input Validation: UUID format checks, missing body, malformed JSON, inconsistent state data, and required header enforcement yield 400s (TC03, TC04, TC05, TC08, TC09, TC10).
Headers Handling: Optional reason/comment presence and combinations; whitespace/case variations (TC02, TC24, TC26).
Security/Authorization: 401 for missing/invalid auth; basic injection/XSS hardening covered (TC11, TC18, TC19).
Resilience/Perf: Timeout/degraded dependency behavior and high-load performance tested (TC16, TC21, TC22).
Robustness to Unknown Inputs: Extra body fields and unsupported query params are ignored per tests (TC13, TC25).
gaps: PUT - Partial Update negative path: No scenario ensuring partial updates are rejected if not allowed by the contract (guideline requires rejection unless explicitly allowed).
Authorization/RBAC: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated user lacking admin privileges.
Idempotency: No test proving that repeated identical PUT requests produce the same end state without side effects (idempotent behavior).

Response semantics/headers: No verification that 204 responses have no body and that Content-Type/Accept handling matches spec (story mentions produces application/json; clarify and test headers accordingly).
Auditability: No checks that X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are persisted to audit logs/history for this admin operation.
Schema/Domain rules: Limited coverage of enumerations/allowed values for state fields (e.g., invalid currentPaymentStateName/transactionStatus values beyond generic invalid transition).
Content-Type/Media type errors: No test for missing or incorrect Content-Type resulting in 415 Unsupported Media Type, or unacceptable Accept header (406).
Atomicity/Transactionality: No test proving payment and paymentTransaction state updates are atomic with rollback on partial failures.
Server error handling: No scenario simulating internal failures (e.g., DB error) returning 5xx with a meaningful error payload.
recommendations: Clarify partial update semantics for AdminPayment. If partial updates are not allowed, add a scenario expecting 400 when optional-but-required-for-operation fields are omitted; if allowed, assert only provided fields change and others remain unchanged.
Add RBAC test: authenticated non-admin attempting the PUT should receive 403 Forbidden.
Add idempotency tests: send the same PUT payload multiple times and assert a single state change and identical responses.
Verify response headers/body for 204: assert no response body is returned; confirm Content-Type/Accept behavior matches the API spec (adjust spec if 204 should not declare application/json).
Add audit log assertions: check that CreatedBy, Reason, and Comment are recorded and retrievable via audit/history endpoints.
Expand schema validation: test invalid enum values and boundary conditions for currentPaymentStateName, lastSuccessPaymentState, and transactionStatus with precise error messages.
Add media type error cases: missing Content-Type or wrong media type -> 415; unsupported Accept -> 406.
Test atomicity: induce a mid-operation failure and assert full rollback with no partial state persisted.
Include a controlled 500 Internal Server Error simulation (e.g., DB outage) and assert proper error structure and retry guidance.
Review TC13/TC25 expectations with product owners: confirm whether extra body fields/query params must be ignored (204) or rejected (400) and update tests accordingly.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/admin/queues - Get queues entries

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful retrieval with and without filters, including defaults and combined filters; verifies 200 and content type for the base case.
Empty Response: Covered for no data (no entries) and for filters excluding all data.

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of valid filters (accountId, queueName, serviceName, dates) and flags (withHistory, withInProcessing, withBusEvents, withNotifications), including combinations and some invalid inputs (invalid UUID, malformed dates).
Authorization: Unauthorized access (401) validated.
Error Handling: 400 (invalid accountId, malformed date), 404 (account not found), 500, 503, and 504 scenarios are covered.
Security/Robustness: Injection/XSS attempts are handled without leaking internals.
Performance/Resiliency: Large data volume performance, timeout behavior, transient network recovery, and concurrent requests are exercised.
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination parameters or behavior with large datasets (e.g., page size, cursors).
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No coverage for burst requests, 429 responses, or rate-limit headers.
Caching Behavior: No checks for caching headers (ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GET.
Authorization (Forbidden): No scenario for authenticated but unauthorized/non-admin user returning 403.
Date Filters: Missing tests for only minDate or only maxDate, invalid ranges (minDate > maxDate), and timezone/ISO-8601 nuances.
Boolean Parameters: No validation for invalid boolean values (e.g., withHistory=foo) or case sensitivity handling.
Parameter Validation: No checks for empty string values, unknown or excessively long queueName/serviceName inputs.
Content Negotiation: Only one scenario asserts Content-Type; no tests for Accept header mismatches or 406 responses.
Response Contract: For octet-stream success payload, no schema/format validation; error payload schema consistency is only loosely asserted.
recommendations: Add pagination scenarios (first page, next page/continuation token, max limits, invalid page params) or document that pagination is not applicable for this endpoint.
Introduce rate-limiting tests: rapid-fire requests leading to 429, and verify Retry-After and related headers.
Validate caching behavior: assert ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control on 200 responses; add conditional GET tests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since -> 304).
Add a 403 Forbidden test using an authenticated principal without admin privileges.
Expand date filter coverage: only minDate, only maxDate, minDate > maxDate (expect 400), and timezone/ISO-8601 format cases.
Add negative tests for boolean flags (non-boolean values, mixed case) and assert proper 400 handling.
Add input validation tests for empty and overlong queueName/serviceName values; clarify behavior for unknown names.
Assert Content-Type=application/octet-stream across filtered responses and test Accept header negotiation, including 406 when unsupported.
Define and validate a consistent error response schema and content type (e.g., application/json) across 4xx/5xx cases.
For large datasets, verify streaming/chunked transfer behavior if applicable and ensure memory footprint constraints are respected.
